intro: Crepis gaubae, commonly known as the Gaubae's mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to the arid and coastal climates of its native habitat. It has small, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Crepis gaubae is often found in open habitats such as cliffs and scrublands.
